standing order.translation[0].definition: an arrangement by which a bank pays a fixed amount of money from your account every month, year etc
standing order.translation[1].definition: an arrangement between a bank and a customer for the bank to pay a fixed amount of money regularly from the customer’s bank account to another account
Customers can pay regular bills by standing order.
With a standing order you tell your branch exactly how much is to be paid and when.
an arrangement in which goods are sent regularly in agreed amounts, without the customer having to make a new order each time
They have cancelled their standing order of 12,000 copies a day of the newspaper.
an organization’s rules about how meetings should be held and organized
Parliament is empowered to make standing orders to govern its procedures.
